subject: Re: [svn:parrot] r18643 - in trunk: include/parrot src
body:
On May 25, 2007, at 9:20 PM, chromatic wrote:

> Whoops, that just broke a couple of platforms.  As I understand it,  
> some picky
> compilers only allow simultaneous declarations and assignments at  
> the start
> of a function, not within any block.
>
> I realize that undoes the consting here, but portability wins.

Agreed, but can we get a verification on that first?  I've never had  
any problems with it on Perl 5.  Are we targeting some even-weirder- 
than-Perl-5-runs-on compilers or something?
